pylon noun [C]
(TALL STRUCTURE)

a tall metal structure to which wires carrying electricity are fixed so that they are safely held high above the ground: electricity pylons The roads were littered with downed pylons, power lines and trees.

a tall tower or post that shows the path of flight for an aircraft

pylon noun [C]
(IN TRAFFIC )
US (also traffic cone) a cone-shaped object that is usually red and white or yellow, used to keep vehicles away from an area of road temporarily, usually because repairs are being done to it: Often, the only thing between workers and the highway is a line of orange pylons bordering the closed lanes.
Peter Schaefer/EyeEm/GettyImages
